meeting_processing.description: Single action item with explicit assignee and deadline
meeting_processing.input:
Meeting: Weekly Sync
Date: February 10, 2026
Duration: 15 minutes
Attendees: Alice Chen (PM), Bob Martinez (Design Lead)

Alice: We need the PRD drafted for the mobile redesign. I'll handle it and have it ready by Friday.

Bob: Sounds good, I'll review it once it's done.

meeting_processing.description: Two action items with different assignees
meeting_processing.input:
Meeting: Design & Frontend Sync
Date: February 9, 2026
Duration: 30 minutes
Attendees: Bob Martinez (Design Lead), David Kim (Senior Frontend Engineer)

Bob: I'll update the design system tokens by end of week.

David: And I need to review the frontend component library code for accessibility issues. I'll get that done by Wednesday.

meeting_processing.description: No action items - pure status update
meeting_processing.input:
Meeting: Quarterly Sync
Date: February 8, 2026
Duration: 20 minutes
Attendees: Frank Wu (Eng Manager), Alice Chen (PM)

Frank: Everything is on track with the current sprint. No blockers.

Alice: Great. The product roadmap looks solid. Everyone agrees we're making good progress.

Frank: Agreed. Let's keep the momentum going.

meeting_processing.description: Two backend-focused action items with deadlines
meeting_processing.input:
Meeting: Backend Planning
Date: February 7, 2026
Duration: 25 minutes
Attendees: Elena Rodriguez (Senior Backend Engineer), Grace Thompson (QA Lead)

Elena: I'll optimize the database queries for the dashboard. Should have results by next Wednesday.

Grace: I need to prepare the test plan for the new API endpoints. I'll have it ready by Monday.

Elena: Perfect, that lines up well with our sprint timeline.

meeting_processing.description: Single action item for engineering manager
meeting_processing.input:
Meeting: Hiring Discussion
Date: February 6, 2026
Duration: 20 minutes
Attendees: Frank Wu (Eng Manager), Todd (VP Engineering)

Todd: We're short-staffed on the backend team. Frank, can you draft job descriptions for two backend engineer positions?

Frank: Absolutely. I'll have them ready by end of Q1.

Todd: Great, let's get sourcing started ASAP.

meeting_processing.description: Marketing action item with discussion context
meeting_processing.input:
Meeting: Marketing Sync
Date: February 5, 2026
Duration: 30 minutes
Attendees: Carol Johnson (Product Marketing Manager), Alice Chen (PM)

Alice: The Q4 launch is coming up. We need the marketing materials finalized.

Carol: I'll prepare the go-to-market materials and competitive analysis deck. Should have a first draft by next Friday.

Alice: Also, the team discussed competitive positioning but no specific next steps there yet.

meeting_processing.description: Urgent production incident with high-priority items
meeting_processing.input:
Meeting: URGENT Incident Response
Date: February 10, 2026
Duration: 10 minutes
Attendees: Elena Rodriguez (Backend), David Kim (Frontend), Frank Wu (Eng Manager)

Frank: Production is down. We need all hands on deck NOW.

Elena: I see the payment service is throwing 500 errors. I'll investigate and fix the backend immediately.

David: The frontend is showing error screens too. I'll check the frontend error handling and deploy a fix.

Frank: This is top priority. Drop everything else.

Meeting: Team Retrospective
Date: February 4, 2026
Duration: 45 minutes
Attendees: Frank Wu (Eng Manager), Elena Rodriguez, David Kim, Grace Thompson

Frank: This is our sprint retro. How did everyone feel about the last two weeks?

Elena: The backend work went smoothly. No complaints.

David: Same here. Good collaboration on the component library.

Grace: QA coverage improved this sprint. Happy with the progress.

Frank: Great to hear. Let's keep it up. No changes needed to our process.

assistant_queries.query: Who has Python expertise on the team?
What was discussed in the meeting with Todd about infrastructure?
What is LangGraph and how does it work?
Who is the QA Lead on the team?
What design work was discussed in recent meetings?
